[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Derive: Clone for TransactionScriptABI] [Expensive clone DoS] Can cloning large TransactionScriptABI instances (with megabytes of bytecode) cause performance issues or memory exhaustion, especially if cloning happens in hot paths? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Derive: Clone for ScriptFunctionABI] [Module ID reference sharing] Does cloning ScriptFunctionABI properly deep-copy the ModuleId, or can shared references cause mutation issues if the cloned ABI is modified? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Function: TransactionScriptABI::name()] [Name injection for logging] Can malicious names with ANSI escape codes or log injection payloads corrupt validator logs, hiding malicious activity or causing log parsing failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Function: ScriptFunctionABI::doc()] [XSS via documentation] If doc strings are displayed in web UIs without sanitization, can attackers inject JavaScript or HTML payloads to perform XSS attacks on block explorers or wallets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Function: ArgumentABI::type_tag()] [Type exposure for reconnaissance] Can exposing full type information through type_tag() leak internal type structures, helping attackers understand system architecture for targeted attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ArgumentABI] [Recursive TypeTag stack overflow] Can ArgumentABI contain TypeTag::Vector(Box::new(TypeTag::Vector(...))) nested thousands of levels deep, causing stack overflow during type traversal or validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ArgumentABI] [Circular StructTag references] Can TypeTag::Struct contain type arguments that reference the same struct type, creating logical cycles that cause infinite loops during type resolution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: TransactionScriptABI] [Slice lifetime issues] Can the lifetime of slices returned by code() be violated through unsafe code elsewhere, causing use-after-free vulnerabilities when accessing bytecode? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ScriptFunctionABI] [Reference lifetime exploitation] Do the reference-returning methods (name(), doc(), etc.) have proper lifetime bounds to prevent dangling references if the ABI is moved or dropped prematurely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: TransactionScriptABI] [Non-deterministic serialization] Can floating-point NaN values, if somehow embedded in serialized data, cause non-deterministic comparison results, breaking consensus on transaction ordering? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Enum: ScriptABI] [Enum variant order dependency] If new variants are added to ScriptABI in the future, can the serialization order change, causing old and new validators to compute different hashes for the same ABI? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ScriptFunctionABI] [Privileged function masquerading] Can public ABIs reference private or friend functions in module_name that shouldn't be callable from transactions, bypassing visibility controls? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: TransactionScriptABI] [Bytecode privilege escalation] Can the code field contain bytecode that attempts to call privileged Move VM intrinsics or system functions that should only be accessible to framework code? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: ScriptFunctionABI.ty_args] [Ability constraint bypass] Can TypeArgumentABI lack ability constraints (copy, drop, key, store), allowing generic instantiation with types that violate function requirements, breaking resource safety? [File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: TransactionScriptABI.ty_args] [Generic bound exploitation] Can type arguments violate generic bounds specified in the script bytecode, causing type safety violations when instantiated types are used? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Function: ScriptABI::name()] [Panic on invalid enum] Can corrupted memory or unsafe code create invalid ScriptABI enum discriminants, causing name() to panic when matching on an undefined variant? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Function: TransactionScriptABI::code()] [Empty slice undefined behavior] Does code() handle the case where the code vector is empty, or can returning an empty slice cause undefined behavior in downstream bytecode parsing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ArgumentABI] [Function type argument] Can type_tag be TypeTag::Function, and if so, can first-class function types be passed as arguments in ways that violate capability security or enable reflection attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ArgumentABI] [Signer duplication] Can multiple ArgumentABI entries have TypeTag::Signer, allowing multiple signer arguments that enable signature reuse or authorization bypasses? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: TransactionScriptABI] [Bytecode version confusion] Can old-format bytecode in code be executed on new VM versions without proper migration, causing undefined behavior due to opcode meaning changes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ScriptFunctionABI] [Module upgrade race] Can ScriptFunctionABI reference a module that's upgraded between ABI creation and execution, causing function signature mismatches or calling deleted functions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: TransactionScriptABI] [FFI boundary violations] When code is passed across FFI boundaries to C/C++ code, can buffer overflows occur if the Vec<u8> length isn't properly validated? (High)
